docs.abstract: At Prairie View A&M, one of the historically Black colleges and universities where MacKenzie Scott donated millions, the mood is cautious optimism.
docs.snippet: At Prairie View A&M, one of the historically Black colleges and universities where MacKenzie Scott donated millions, the mood is cautious optimism.
docs.lead_paragraph: PRAIRIE VIEW, Texas — In-person learning resumed at Prairie View A&M University at the end of August, and the campus was soon buzzing with familiar sounds and sights: freshmen laughing in the dining hall, students walking across the sprawling yard in between classes.

headline.main: What a $50 Million Donation Did for One H.B.C.U.

docs.abstract: The sociologist Louise Seamster discusses America’s student debt crisis and how higher education contributes to the racial wealth gap.
docs.snippet: The sociologist Louise Seamster discusses America’s student debt crisis and how higher education contributes to the racial wealth gap.
docs.lead_paragraph: Public policy in the United States often overlooks wealth. We tend to design, debate and measure our economic policies with regard to income alone, which blinds us to the ways prosperity and precarity tangibly function in people’s lives. And that blind spot can ultimately prevent us from addressing social inequality at its roots.

headline.main: The Life-Altering Differences Between White and Black Debt

docs.abstract: National Development calls for a strong government guiding a more self-sufficient economy.
docs.snippet: National Development calls for a strong government guiding a more self-sufficient economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: National Development is the online magazine that Alexander Hamilton might have written for if web zines had existed in 1787. The magazine, which debuted on Sept. 17, is devoted to what Hamilton, the first secretary of the Treasury, fought for: a strong national government that guides and helps the development of a productive, more self-sufficient economy.

headline.main: The New Magazine Alexander Hamilton Might Have Written For

docs.abstract: Memories of the Yellow Vest movement are prompting officials to ensure that spiking energy prices don’t fuel inequality or populist discontent.
docs.snippet: Memories of the Yellow Vest movement are prompting officials to ensure that spiking energy prices don’t fuel inequality or populist discontent.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Raucous demonstrations against high energy bills in Spain. Demands for social protection in Greece as coal mines close. Fresh protests in French rural areas and small towns over spiking petrol prices.

headline.main: Europe Fears That Rising Cost of Climate Action Is Stirring Anger

docs.abstract: Mario Draghi started the Group of 20 meeting in Rome with a message that advocated multilateralism and the fair disbursement of vaccines between rich and poor nations.
docs.snippet: Mario Draghi started the Group of 20 meeting in Rome with a message that advocated multilateralism and the fair disbursement of vaccines between rich and poor nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi started the Group of 20 meeting in Rome with a message that advocated multilateralism and the fair disbursement of vaccines between rich and poor nations.

headline.main: Italian Prime Minister Opens G20 Summit

docs.abstract: A proposed ‘billionaire tax’ appears to have been shelved, but questions about how to best tax extreme wealth remain.
docs.snippet: A proposed ‘billionaire tax’ appears to have been shelved, but questions about how to best tax extreme wealth remain.
docs.lead_paragraph: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offers a better understanding of an important issue in the news. If you don’t already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

headline.print_headline: Many Questions Remain About the Best Way to Tax Billionaires

docs.abstract: The world’s leaders are focusing on preventing future pandemics, but experts say rich nations are not doing enough to help the poor survive the current one.
docs.snippet: The world’s leaders are focusing on preventing future pandemics, but experts say rich nations are not doing enough to help the poor survive the current one.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME — From the opening moments of the Group of 20 summit on Saturday, the leaders of the world’s largest economies wanted to send a strong message about ending the coronavirus pandemic: During an unconventional group photograph, they were joined on the dais by doctors in white coats and first responders from the Italian Red Cross.

headline.main: Pressure Grows on G20 Nations to Get Covid Vaccines to the Poor
headline.print_headline: Pressure Grows on Rich Nations to Help World’s Poor Get Vaccines

byline.original: By Katie Rogers, Jim Tankersley and Jason Horowitz

docs.abstract: They are tech titans, entertainment moguls and heirs to great fortunes. Their ranks grew during the pandemic, changing the political conversation around taxing the wealthy.
docs.snippet: They are tech titans, entertainment moguls and heirs to great fortunes. Their ranks grew during the pandemic, changing the political conversation around taxing the wealthy.
docs.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

byline.original: By Nicholas Kulish, Ephrat Livni and Emma Goldberg

docs.abstract: Wealthier countries with high vaccination rates have had speedier economic recoveries than poorer countries with low vaccination rates, the International Labor Organization said.
docs.snippet: Wealthier countries with high vaccination rates have had speedier economic recoveries than poorer countries with low vaccination rates, the International Labor Organization said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Unequal access to coronavirus vaccines in developing countries is deepening a “great divergence” between rich and poor nations and slowing economic recovery from the pandemic, the United Nations organization that monitors labor market developments said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Unequal vaccine access is widening the global economic gap, a U.N. agency says.

docs.abstract: The plan stakes out new territory by putting levies on unrealized gains in the value of billionaires’ liquid assets, such as stocks, bonds and cash.
docs.snippet: The plan stakes out new territory by putting levies on unrealized gains in the value of billionaires’ liquid assets, such as stocks, bonds and cash.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Democrats plan to tax the richest of the rich, hoping to extract hundreds of billions of dollars from the mountains of wealth that billionaires sit on to help pay for their social safety net and climate change policies.

headline.main: How Democrats Would Tax Billionaires to Pay for Their Agenda
